glsa.title: PostgreSQL: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: PostgreSQL contains a vulnerability that could result in SQL privilege escalation.

background.p: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.

description.p: An error involving insecure search_path settings in the SECURITY DEFINER functions has been reported in PostgreSQL.

impact.p: If allowed to call a SECURITY DEFINER function, an attacker could gain the SQL privileges of the owner of the called function.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PostgreSQL users should upgrade to the latest version and fix their SECURITY DEFINER functions:
In order to fix the SECURITY DEFINER functions, PostgreSQL users are advised to refer to the PostgreSQL documentation: http://www.postgresql .org/docs/techdocs.77
